sec.div: Carbon sequestration from reduced wood yield (CSRW)
sec.p:
The reduced yield of wood is one of the project measures in ecological restoration projects that contributes to carbon sequestration via reduced logging and the corresponding loss of biomass. The carbon sequestration from a reduced wood yield was determined via the following equation Eq. (5).
(5)CSRW
t = CSF w × (WY
t – WY 0) × 10 -3 where CSRW
t is the carbon sequestration from the reduced yield of wood in the t th year (Gg C), CSF w is the carbon sequestration factor of the wood yield reduction, 0.68 t C·m -3 [ 13], WY
t is the wood yield in the t th year (m 3) [ 11], and WY 0 is the wood yield in the year before the implementation of the project (m 3) [ 11].
